;;A; ;十年前; 金融各部委陷入紧缩热潮。即使失业率高企、经济增长疲软，各国政府仍竭尽全力削减预算赤字。今天，情况已大不相同。在整个西方，大多数经济体的状况都较好。人们有工作。企业利润增长强劲。然而，各国政府的支出远远超过其收入。

;

;没有哪个政府比美国政府更加挥霍。今年，这个世界最大经济体的预算赤字（支出超过税收）预计将超过;GDP;的 7%，这一水平在经济衰退和战时之外是闻所未闻的。但它并不是唯一一个挥霍无度的国家。爱沙尼亚和芬兰这两个一向节俭的北欧国家目前正面临巨额预算赤字。去年，继 2007-09 年全球金融危机之后，意大利的赤字规模与 2010-11 年一样大，而法国的赤字占;GDP;的比例增长至 5.5%，远高于预测。财政部长布鲁诺·勒梅尔上个月宣布：“我呼吁集体敲响警钟，在我们所有的公共支出中做出选择。”

;;
;;
;

;一些国家比较保守。去年塞浦路斯出现盈余。希腊和葡萄牙——接近平衡预算——看起来像是财政廉洁的典范，尽管它们仍然背负着巨额债务。尽管如此，总体方向还是明确的。 ;《经济学人》;分析了来自 35 个富裕国家的数据。 2017-19 年，我们样本中的中等国家;;实现了预算盈余，而去年的预算赤字接近 ;GDP ;的 2.5%（见图 1）。 “主要”赤字（不包括利息支付）和“结构性”赤字（脱离经济周期）的衡量标准也急剧扩大。

;
;
;< div id="econ-1" class="adComponent_adcontainer__eooQr">;
;
;
;

;有两个因素解释了这种挥霍行为。第一个与税收有关。在整个富裕国家，收入出人意料地疲弱。在美国，去年从工资中扣除的所得税收入略有下降。与此同时，“非预扣所得税”，包括资本利得税，下降了四分之一。英国的资本利得税收入比近期高点低了 11%。日本本财年的自我评估税（包括一些资本利得税）预计将比去年低 4%。

;

;由于 2022 年底和 2023 年初的市场动荡，税务人员正在遭受苦难。支付高薪的科技公司解雇了员工，削减了所得税。随着股价下跌，家庭和投资者出售股票以获取利润变得更加困难，从而减少了资本收益池。去年，随着房价下跌，很少有人通过炒房赚钱。私募股权公司的高级员工通常以投资回报而非传统工资的形式获得收入，今年过得很糟糕。

;

;第二个因素是国家支出。继新冠肺炎 (covid-19) 大流行期间采取了不择手段的财政政策后，各国政府已经紧缩，但并未完全紧缩。在澳大利亚，养老院的老年人在新冠疫情爆发期间仍可能获得经济援助。直到 2023 年中期，德国才完全取消了疫情期间实施的就业保护计划。美国仍在向小企业支付大量退税，这些企业在封锁期间让人们继续工作。在意大利，2020 年制定的一个旨在鼓励房主绿色家园的项目已经失控，政府迄今已支付了价值 2000 亿欧元的支持（或占 ;GDP; 的 10%）。其中一项计划的名称“Superbonus”如果不是那么挥霍的话，会很有趣。

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;政客们也变得更愿意进行干预并花钱——为了纠正感知到的错误。俄罗斯入侵乌克兰、能源价格飙升后，欧洲各国政府拨出约 4% 的 GDP 来保护家庭和企业免受影响。包括波兰和波罗的海国家在内的一些国家现在在枪支和士兵上投入巨资。乔·拜登总统希望在 11 月美国总统大选之前尽可能多地免除学生债务。

;

;消防水带还能喷多久？乍一看，似乎还能持续一段时间。市场大幅上涨，这将增加税收收入。政府的债务可持续性不会仅仅因为预算赤字的变化而改变。它也是总体公共债务、经济增长、通货膨胀和利率的产物。自疫情结束以来，通货膨胀率一直很高，经济增长也很稳健。尽管费率有所上升，但按照历史标准来看仍然相当低。

;
;;
;

;这些条件使政客处于财政最佳状态（见图 2）。我们计算出，在 2022-23 年，中等富裕国家的基本赤字约为 ;GDP ;的 2%，同时仍降低了公共债务与 ;GDP ;的比率。债务的名义价值将会上升，但在通货膨胀的帮助下，经济规模将会扩大得更多。一些国家面临着更加有利的环境。尽管意大利实行宽松的财政政策，但其债务比率占 GDP 的比重较 2021 年的峰值下降了约 10 个百分点。法国的这一比例也有所下降。希腊将有利的经济状况与紧缩的财政政策相结合，其债务与;gdp;之比惊人地下降了 50 个百分点。

;;

;美国例外主义

;< p data-component="paragraph" class="css-1f0x4sl e1tt35bk0">;然而，现在情况正在改变。尽管经济增长和通胀下降，但政府面临的利率尚未下降。这已经让财政算术变得更加令人畏惧。比如，意大利政府一贯保持债务率稳定的首要立场，根据我们的测算，去年的赤字占GDP的1%;已经下降到了今年的2%的盈余。美国的处境非常相似。通胀进一步下降、经济增长放缓或利率上升将使政府更难稳定债务。

;

;也就不足为奇了最近，有关财政整顿的讨论越来越多。意大利政府相信其立场很快就会受到欧盟的谴责。在英国，希望不久之后掌权的反对党工党承诺实施财政整顿。法国政府谈论削减医疗支出和失业救济金。美国是个例外。在世界领先的经济体中，谈话仍然没有转变。大选前，唐纳德·特朗普和拜登承诺为数百万选民减税。但财政逻辑是无情的。无论他们喜欢与否，政客挥霍无度的时代都将结束。 ;■;

;;A;;N 田园诗般的城市;在加利福尼亚州时髦的奥兰治县，你不会想到会遇到一个自称无产阶级冠军的人。亨廷顿海滩最初因石油而闻名（高中的吉祥物仍然是油人队），然后因冲浪而闻名。然而，共和党市长格雷西·范德马克(Gracey Van Der Mark)就是这样看待自己和她的城市的。她办公室的墙上挂着一份镶框的《洛杉矶时报》最近一篇专栏文章，建议（半开玩笑地）唐纳德·特朗普应该选她担任副总统。她说其他城市都害怕该州民主党州长加文·纽瑟姆，“因为他的行为就像一个暴君”。

;

;纽瑟姆先生涉嫌暴政其根源在于他的政府坚持认为城市应该建造更多的住房，而国家急需这些住房，而许多拥有富裕居民和数十座海滨平房的城市对此表示不满。在范德马克女士看来，这并不是他唯一的罪行。亨廷顿比奇在多个方面与该州作斗争，从住房法规到投票规则，再到悬挂同性恋骄傲旗帜。该市针对纽瑟姆先生的不明智的斗争象征着加州众多共和党势力与自由派州政府之间的摩擦。以及特朗普时代加州共和党的演变。

;
;
;
;< /div>;
;
;

;约 41% 的亨廷顿海滩居民是注册共和党人，这使他们成为该市最大的政治部落。但最近这座城市的共和主义风格发生了变化。 2022 年，范德马克女士和几位《MAGA》同胞以候选人身份竞选市议会议员。所有人都当选了，现在与三名民主党人一起任职——尽管地方选举从技术上讲是无党派的。该委员会的民主党人朗达·博尔顿 (Rhonda Bolton) 表示，该机构的政治已经成为有毒的污泥，与美国众议院非常相似。

;

;这并不是亨廷顿海滩和政府所在地萨克拉门托的州第一次在住房问题上发生争执。 2019年，该州起诉该市涉嫌阻碍新开发项目。这次的麻烦源于该市未能批准建造住房以满足预计需求的计划，而该州每个地方政府都必须完成这一过程。州和市就此事相互起诉。该市的诉讼理由是国家不能强迫地方建设，但被驳回。该州的诉讼仍在审理中。

;

;市议会在三月份的初选上提出了几项有争议的措施，其中包括一项将引入选民- ;ID; 规则。负责投票程序的加州总检察长兼国务卿警告该市，此类措施违反了州法律。无论如何，这项措施还是通过了。另一场法律诉讼可能正在等待着。

;

;范德马克女士认为亨廷顿海滩可以制定自己的住房和投票规则，因为它是一个特许城市。加州宪法中的“地方自治”条款规定，这些采用地方宪法的城市可以“制定和执行与市政事务有关的所有法令和法规”。但该州宪法没有定义“市政事务”，让法院来决定什么是适当的。加州超过五分之一的城市拥有特许状。但亨廷顿海滩已成为地方自治的最大支持者。 “萨克拉门托将我们作为其他城市的榜样，”范德马克女士说。至少在这一点上，市政府和州政府达成了一致。

;
;
;
;;
;
;

;加州共和党人往往比东部同行更加温和。作为州长，罗纳德·里根赞成采取一些环境保护措施。阿诺·施瓦辛格环游世界，警告气候变化。然而事实证明，特朗普先生的影响力太强大，这种温和派无法持续下去。

;

;博尔顿女士表示，她认为大多数亨廷顿海滩居民比其他人更加温和委员会不会长期容忍这种欺骗行为。但选举周期对她不利。十一月选民将有机会驱逐她和其他民主党人。范德马克女士要到 2026 年才能竞选连任。该专栏暗示她是特朗普在奥兰治县的忠实士兵，这让她很高兴，但坚称除非“某个地方需要她”，否则她不会竞选更高职位。< span class="ufinish">;■;

;;C;;睫毛;一部 20 世纪 70 年代的电影《唐人街》以大萧条时期的洛杉矶为背景，供水造成致命事故。 “大旱之时，水使淹死”，一位人物惊叹道。英国最新一部水剧的受害者是企业。 4 月 5 日，英国最大的水务公司泰晤士水务公司的母公司拖欠了 14 亿英镑（17 亿美元）的债券。一场精心设计、旷日持久的重组即将到来。

;

;罪魁祸首的名单很长。首先是该公司负债累累的财务结构。其债务股本比率为78%；行业平均水平为 68%，监管机构 Ofwat 建议为 55%。这些债务分散在拜占庭式的多层公司结构中。值得注意的是，其大部分债务与通胀相关。理论上这不应该是一个问题；尽管通货膨胀率上升，但公司的主要收入来源水费也与通货膨胀相关。问题在于，债务支付与零售价格指数挂钩，自 2020 年以来，零售价格指数比与水费挂钩的通货膨胀指标 ;CPI-H; 上涨了 10%。泰晤士水务公司的部分债券定价近乎惨淡。

;
;
;
;< /div>;
;
;

;接下来，管理不善。泰晤士水务公司在 Ofwat 的效率排名中垫底。莎拉·本特利 (Sarah Bentley) 于 6 月辞去了;首席执行官;的职务，此时距八年转型计划已经实施两年了。环境罚款加剧了压力：该公用事业公司的污水溢出记录相当难看。 Ofwat 对此也负有责任：在其成立 30 年的大部分时间里，监管机构一直一心一意地控制账单。有时这是以维护和改善水基础设施为代价的。功能失调的规划系统也无济于事：英格兰最后一个主要供水水库于 1991 年竣工。

;

;泰晤士水务公司游说 Ofwat特殊待遇：削减罚款并批准大幅增加账单。以这种方式让股东摆脱困境将是一个错误。如果他们不拿出更多的钱，泰晤士水务公司应该接受特别管理，这是一种破产形式，可以让该公用事业公司保持运转，直到找到新的所有者。就像公司破产一样，股东将被消灭，债务持有人将受到沉重打击。然后，新所有者可以接管基础资产，而不会继承沉重的债务负担。

;

;进入特别管理将是做出更大改变的机会， 也。牛津大学教授迪特·赫尔姆爵士认为，泰晤士水务公司规模庞大，难以管理。他建议将供水和污水处理工作分开，并将伦敦与泰晤士河流域的其他地区分开。

;

;但是如果泰晤士河水务是一个异常值，其他水务公司也有许多问题。问题的关键在于该行业特殊的结构。供水是典型的自然垄断。由于公用事业之间不可能竞争，政府对私有化的自来水公司实行严格的监管。 Ofwat 设定公司可以收取的账单，确定他们可以进行哪些投资并选择回报率。

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;这些决定每五年做出一次。下一次审查涵盖 2025 年至 2029 年底，预计将于 12 月结束。过去的迭代一直存在争议。 2019年，Ofwat否决了该行业提出的30%的资产改善投资，称这些计划缺乏明确的理由，而且物有所值。现在 Ofwat 表示，其想法已经转变，希望在投资方面做出重大改变。这意味着要在水费中提高资金，尽管实际上比公司开放的出价少于31％（请参阅图表）。

;

;欢迎音调的变化。但是，Ofwat是否会转移足够的问题是一个悬而未决的问题。一条腰带将是允许的回报率，这对于吸引急需的外国资本至关重要。 Ofwat的脑袋为3.29％加通货膨胀（通过; cpih ;衡量）。鉴于该行业的风险增加和整个经济中的无风险利率较高，几乎可以肯定的是太低了。在过去几年的困难之后，投资者不会通过中间回报引诱到水中。

;

;“唐人街”洛杉矶的供水（以及暴力）。鉴于人口增长和气候变化的压力，英国吱吱作响的水基础设施也需要升级。这需要更多的投资。泰晤士水上传奇的正确结局将涉及当前股东和未来账单付款人的痛苦。 ;■;

;政府如何处理外国大使馆的规范延伸了几个世纪。古希腊和罗马政府对外国使节及其使团给予保护。 1961 年，这些规则在《维也纳外交关系公约》中正式确定。第22条规定，外交馆舍不受侵犯。未经大使或使团团长同意，当地警察或安全部队不得进入使馆。东道国有义务保护场地。根据东道国的法律，在那里工作的人免于起诉。一些政府抱怨说，这使得大使馆可以庇护肮脏的人物。但是规则很重要：它们允许外交官在不担心被骚扰或劫持人质的情况下工作，并可以帮助保持有态度关系的国家之间的稳定性。

;

;违反不可侵犯的后果可能很严重。美国国务院认为对其一个使馆的袭击是对美国本身的攻击。事实上，大使馆的特殊地位只是偶尔受到严重考验。 1979年，在伊朗新的革命伊斯兰政府的支持下，学生活动家扩大了美国大使馆在德黑兰的墙壁，并在444天持有50多名美国外交官。国际法院（; ICJ ;）迅速裁定针对伊朗。两国之间的关系从未恢复过，伊朗仍然是国际贱民。

;

;一些政府试图破坏滥用不可侵犯性。 1984 年，一名警察伊冯·弗莱彻 (Yvonne Fletcher) 在伦敦广场被利比亚大使馆内的枪手杀害，此后，英国通过了一项法律，取消了对被滥用的外交馆舍的保护。迄今为止，该法律只使用过一次，清除了侵占长期空置的柬埔寨大使馆的擅自占地者。 Wikileaks的创始人朱利安·阿桑奇（Julian Assange）在伦敦驻厄瓜多尔大使馆寻求庇护，以避免因性侵犯指控避免引渡瑞典。 （这些指控后来被撤销，但阿桑奇先生在厄瓜多尔于2019年撤销了庇护后被英国警察逮捕，并且是;战斗引渡;到美国，他在那里被控黑客攻击政府计算机。）

;; T;;HE INDIA; I grew up in had just secured its independence and was struggling to meet essential needs like food, fuel and foreign exchange.按卡路里含量计算，中国现在是世界第二大食品生产国，也是食品净出口国。印度仍然进口燃料，但越来越多地利用太阳能和风能。外汇储备创历史新高。 India is now the world's fifth-largest economy and some analysts predict it could be the third-largest by 2027.

;

;In the past, during negotiations with the multilateral organisations and investors, India would often be described as a country of great potential that would remain one. For many years the gibe may not have been entirely unfair: India progressed in fits and starts.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;The balance-of-payments crisis in 1991-93 was an important course correction for macroeconomic stability and structural reforms. 1996 年和 1998-2004 年，在阿塔尔·比哈里·瓦杰帕伊 (Atal Bihari Vajpayee) 的领导下，发生了进一步的重大变化：电信和公路网络得到了扩展，提高了生产力，将欠发达地区与先进地区结合起来，并刺激了印度制造业的竞争。 The Fiscal Responsibility and Budget Management (;FRBM;) Act of 2003 marked another turning point, underlining the importance of economic stability for private investment. But then reforms slowed from 2004 to 2014.

;

;During the past ten years, however, India has decisively disproved the “country of potential” quip 。国际货币基金组织将该国描述为经济“亮点”。 Research by the State Bank of India finds a steady decline in the incremental capital-output ratio—a measure of the relationship between investment and increase in ;GDP;—to 4.4 in the latest April-to-March financial year, compared to 7.5 a decade before. This suggests that part of India's growth stems from producing more with less.

;

;India has set itself the target of becoming a developed economy by 2047, the year that marks the centenary of its independence. What issues does it need to focus on to get there?

;

;The first is poverty.对于一个拥有 14 亿人口的人口稠密国家来说，消除这种现象必定是任何有意义的经济战略存在的理由。如果您接受印度对贫困的官方定义——每天收入略低于 2 美元——那么农村贫困率估计为 2.5%，城市贫困率为 1%。这些估计未考虑各种政府计划提供的免费食品和其他直接转移福利。尽管如此，印度应该瞄准更高的目标。 Poverty must be brought down, and this should be done while raising the official definition from the current level to at least $3 of daily income, ideally $3.50.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;The second task is to maintain macroeconomic stability by implementing the ;FRBM; act. Under this law, the fiscal deficit was to be reduced to 3% of ;GDP; for both central and state governments, and the debt-to-;GDP; ratio was to be reduced to 60%。 Twenty years later this still has not happened.

;

;The increased public spending needed to handle the covid-19 pandemic made those goals even more elusive. Since the pandemic, however, the situation has improved: the budget estimate of the likely fiscal deficit for the 2023-24 financial year indicates a narrowing, to 5.8% of ;GDP;, and the government hopes to reduce it to 4.5% in 2025-26. Public debt appears to be falling, too—towards 80% of ;GDP; compared to almost 90% in 2020-21. Alongside this, productivity will rise if the government continues to shift more of its spending into asset-creating capital projects.

;

;The third big issue is tackling climate change.印度正在通过 2015 年《巴黎协定》中的“国家自主贡献”积极发挥自己的作用。它也是部门倡议的领导者，例如由 118 个国家组成的政府间组织国际太阳能联盟。它已开始重组农业，减少对化石燃料的依赖，例如转向生产小米等能源密集度较低的谷物。 And it is ploughing money into green hydrogen.

;

;But India still has far to go to significantly reduce its dependence on fossil fuels.有序转型需要提高国有配电公司的效率，逐步淘汰效率低下的化石燃料发电厂，并加快向可再生能源供电电网的转变。国家层面的改变还不够。 It will also require international action, not least further reform of multilateral development banks, based on the recommendations of the ;G20;'s Independent Expert Group.

;

;The fourth area of concern is skills development.印度抚养比（年轻人口或老年人口的比例）不断下降，使得提高技能和推出新技术（包括提供更好的在线课程）变得更加重要。政府的新国民教育政策正在使国家走上正轨。 It may also help to bring much of the grey economy into the formal sector.

;

;India must develop a new model of growth, relying on technology instead of on more incremental and material-intensive manufacturing and export-led growth.印度永远不会成为制造业出口强国。 Its best hope for future growth lies in focusing on capital expenditure and in further developing its service sectors.

;

;Geopolitical risks that make energy more expensive or interrupt critical supply chains will pose challenges.但他们不会让印度脱轨。 The country's recent stint chairing the ;G20,; and the resulting New Delhi Leaders' Declaration, showed how relations with America and Russia can be balanced, allowing India to, for instance, continue to import oil at affordable prices. As a large, growing market with much unsaturated demand, India is well placed to turn geopolitical uncertainties to its advantage.

;

;India's leaders have good reasons to want to achieve the four big goals.他们明白，政治稳定取决于强劲的经济增长以及通过技术支持的公共分配系统和各种补贴支付有效提供公共产品。这可能最终是印度的时刻。 ;■;

;;I;;n “Permutation City”;, a novel by Greg Egan, the character Peer, having achieved immortality within a virtual reality over which he has total control, finds himself terribly bored.因此，他让自己拥有了新的激情。某一时刻，他正在突破高等数学的界限；另一时刻，他正在突破高等数学的界限。接下来他正在写歌剧。 “他甚至一度对极乐世界（来世）感兴趣。不再。他更喜欢考虑桌腿。”皮尔的反复无常与更深层次的问题有关。 When technology has solved humanity's deepest problems, what is left to do?

;

;That is one question considered in a new book by Nick Bostrom, a philosopher at the University of Oxford, whose ;last book; argued that humanity faced a one-in-six chance of being wiped out in the next 100 years, perhaps owing to the development of dangerous forms of artificial intelligence (;AI;).在博斯特罗姆先生的最新出版物《深度乌托邦》中，他考虑了一个截然不同的结果。 What happens if ;AI ;goes extraordinarily well?在书中提出的一种情况下，该技术发展到可以以接近零成本完成所有具有经济价值的工作的程度。 Under a yet more radical scenario, even tasks that you might think would be reserved for humans, such as parenting, can be done better by ;AI;.; ;This may sound more dystopian than utopian, but Mr Bostrom argues otherwise.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;Start with the first scenario, which Mr Bostrom labels a “post-scarcity” Utopia.在这样的世界里，对工作的需求将会减少。大约一个世纪前，约翰·梅纳德·凯恩斯 (John Maynard Keynes) 写了一篇题为《我们的孙辈的经济可能性》的文章，其中预测 100 年后，他富有的后代每周只需工作 15 个小时。这虽然还没有完全实现，但工作时间却大大减少了。在富裕国家，平均每周工作时间已从 19 世纪末的 60 多小时降至如今的不足 40 小时。典型的美国人将三分之一的醒着时间花在休闲活动和运动上。未来，他们可能希望把时间花在人类当前概念之外的事情上。 As Mr Bostrom writes, when aided by powerful tech, “the space of possible-for-us experiences extends far beyond those that are accessible to us with our present unoptimised brains.”

;

;Yet Mr Bostrom's label of a “post-scarcity” Utopia might be slightly misleading: the economic explosion caused by superintelligence would still be limited by physical resources, most notably land.尽管太空探索可能会极大地增加可用的建筑空间，但它不会使其变得无限。也有一些中间世界，人类在那里发展出强大的新智能形式，但并没有成为太空旅行者。 In such worlds, wealth may be fantastic, but lots of it could be absorbed by housing—much as is the case in rich countries today.

;

;“Positional goods”, which boost the status of their owners, are also still likely to exist and are, by their nature, scarce. Even if ;AI;s surpass humans in art, intellect, music and sport, humans will probably continue to derive value from surpassing their fellow humans;例如，拥有最热门活动的门票。 1977 年，经济学家弗雷德·赫希 (Fred Hirsch) 在《增长的社会限制》一书中指出，随着财富的增加，人类欲望的更大一部分由地位商品组成。 Time spent competing goes up, the price of such goods increases and so their share of ;GDP ;rises. This pattern may continue in an ;AI; Utopia.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;Mr Bostrom notes some types of competition are a failure of co-ordination: if everyone agrees to stop competing, they would have time for other, better things, which could further boost growth.然而，某些类型的竞争，例如体育运动，具有内在价值，值得保留。 (Humans may also have nothing better to do.) Interest in chess has grown since ;IBM;'s Deep Blue first defeated Garry Kasparov, then world champion, in 1997. An entire industry has emerged around e-sports, where computers can comfortably defeat humans;他们的收入预计在未来十年以每年 20% 的速度增长，到 2032 年将达到近 110 亿美元。当今社会的一些群体让我们了解未来人类可能如何度过他们的时间。贵族和波西米亚人喜欢艺术。僧侣们生活在自己的内心。运动员一生都在运动中度过。 The retired dabble in all these pursuits.

;;

;Everyone's early retirement

;

;Won't tasks such as parenting remain the refuge of humans?博斯特罗姆先生不太确定。 He argues that beyond the post-scarcity world lies a “post-instrumental” one, in which ;AI;s would become superhuman at child care, too.凯恩斯本人写道：“我认为，没有哪个国家、没有哪个民族能够毫无恐惧地展望悠闲和富裕的时代。因为我们已经接受了太久的训练，不去奋斗，不去享受……从今天世界上任何一个地区的富裕阶层的行为和成就来判断，前景都非常令人沮丧！” The Bible puts it more succinctly: “idle hands are the devil's workshop.”

;

;These dynamics suggest a “paradox of progress”.尽管大多数人都想要一个更美好的世界，但如果技术变得太先进，他们可能会失去目标。博斯特罗姆先生认为，大多数人仍然会喜欢具有内在价值的活动，例如吃美味的食物。乌托邦主义者认为生活变得太容易了，他们可能会决定挑战自己，也许通过殖民一个新星球来尝试从头开始重新设计文明。然而，到了某个时候，即使是这样的冒险也可能不再值得。正如皮尔在《排列城市》中所做的那样，人类会在激情之间快乐地跳跃多久，这是一个悬而未决的问题。长期以来，经济学家一直认为人类拥有“无限的需求和欲望”，这表明人们想要消费的东西有无穷无尽的变化。 With the arrival of an ;AI; Utopia, this would be put to the test.很大程度上取决于结果。 ;■;

;;F;;OR ALMOST; as long as it has been accepted in China that “to get rich is glorious” , it has also been known that to ; get out can be glorious;, too.许多刚富裕起来的中国公民的移民冲动是“投资移民”业务增长的一个重要原因。据该行业的游说团体投资移民委员会称，80多个国家提供了一些计划，为进行大量投资的外国人提供快速居留权（“黄金签证”），甚至公民身份（“黄金护照”）。 sums. The most popular has been America's, where the waiting-list for Chinese applicants reached 15 years in 2022. For tiny countries such as Vanuatu and St Kitts and Nevis citizenship-by-investment schemes are important sources of foreign exchange.

;

;China is the biggest source of demand, but far from the only one. People all over the world want to move countries—to flee persecution, political instability or, in some cases, justice. Many simply hope to secure a better education for their children or to work somewhere with a pleasant climate and good cuisine. The money they bring to their host countries seems to make such arrangements a win-win. Yet, as the closure in recent years of a number of schemes demonstrates, they are highly controversial.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;In every country the question of who has the right to live there is a sensitive one. But for the European Union (;EU;) in particular golden visas raise fundamental issues.它们涉及最“国家”的能力之一——生活在一个国家——然而，由于申根安排允许在欧盟大部分地区自由流动，因此产生了整个联盟的影响。 There has been a prolonged tussle between Brussels and the countries offering visas and passports in return for investment.

;

;The European Commission and the ;OECD;, a rich-country think-tank, have long worried that golden visas provide cover for money-laundering.这些担忧并非没有根据。例如，在希腊，中国投资者于 2018 年被指控参与了一场骗局，一名希腊开发商以市场价购买房产，然后以高价出售给中国的潜在投资移民，然后向他们偿还部分费用。

;

;In 2022 the European Parliament called for an outright ban on golden passports and the imposition of strict rules on golden visas. On passports Brussels seems to be winning. Malta is now the only ;EU ;country still to offer citizenship by investment. On visas, too, things are getting tougher. In 2023 Greece doubled the minimum investment under its scheme to €500,000 ($543,000) in some of the more popular parts of the country, though opposition parties still claim it is the world's most popular and want it closed.

;

;On April 8th Spain revealed plans to ditch its programme, which offered non-;EU; citizens who invested more than 500,000 euros ($541,250) the right to live and work there on a renewable permit that made them eligible for permanent residency after ten years.该计划的最大用户是中国和俄罗斯公民。其90%以上的投资都投向了房地产。 It is the scheme's alleged effect on the property market—pushing the cost of buying or renting property out of the reach of many locals—that has prompted Spain's government to seek to drop it.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;That is a relatively common concern.出于类似原因，爱尔兰于 2023 年 2 月关闭了类似计划。当月，葡萄牙宣布终止其黄金签证计划，这是旨在解决住房危机的一揽子措施的一部分。 A revised scheme came into effect in October: investment in property or property funds no longer qualifies.

;

;The concern about golden visas is not confined to欧洲。 In January Australia scrapped its scheme, offering permanent residence to foreigners who invested at least A$5m ($3.3m). Thousands have been issued since the visa was introduced in 2012, with most going to Chinese citizens. But the programme has been criticised for fostering corruption. Similar fears in Britain—;focused on Russian; rather than Chinese criminality—led to its ditching its “Tier-1” visa for wealthy foreigners in 2022 just before the invasion of Ukraine.

;

;The investment-migration market is getting tighter, as governments find ever more reasons to question whether its economic benefits outweigh its political and other costs.金钱仍然可以为您购买签证，在某些地方甚至可以购买护照。 But the world's footloose rich are finding it can't buy you love.;■;

;;S;;NIFFY TYPES 蔑视“全球南方”的概念，近年来这个概念已经成为一种流行文化。它的不足是显而易见的：三个词永远无法捕捉到从摩洛哥到马来西亚及其他地区的100多个国家的复杂性。 But the phrase has been adopted by Joe Biden, Emmanuel Macron and Xi Jinping.

;

;The simplest working definition is that it refers to the majority of non-Western countries.它的使用还表示新兴经济体如何对全球事务有更多的权力，并且经常对西方政策有批判性的看法。因此，据说全球南方对加沙的战争感到愤怒，并且对西方对乌克兰，19岁和气候政策的决定不满意。 Sarang Shidore of the Quincy Institute for Responsible Statecraft, an American think-tank, says “the global south exists not as a coherent, organised grouping so much as a geopolitical fact.”

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;If the global south exists, sort of, then who leads it?纳伦德拉·莫迪（Narendra Modi）建议印度可能是“全球南方的声音”。巴西总统路易斯·伊纳西奥·卢拉·达席尔瓦（Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva，简称卢拉）认为他的国家也可能如此。为了研究这个问题，我们已经与一群学者合作，以解决有关贸易，财务和外交链接的数据。我们的结论是，违反直觉，美国在全球南方仍然具有最大的影响力，但是在群体本身中，中国在迄今为止已成为最强大的成员，XI先生是领导领导的最强烈主张。 The sting is that China's influence has glaring limits, and could even backfire. Meanwhile other powers are on the rise.

;

;We worked with the Pardee Centre for International Futures (;PCIF;) at the University of Denver. It has built an index of states' power from 1960 to 2022. The main metric is catchily known as “formal bilateral influence capacity”, a measure of how much power country A may have over country B, based on two dimensions.首先，“带宽”或来回的联系程度：贸易量，外交代表等。其次，“依赖”：B国有多少依赖于武器，贷款，投资等国家A。更多的联系意味着更多的国家有机会发挥影响力，而权力的不对称性使这样做更容易。 Think of China's power over Pakistan, for instance: there are both lots of connections and China has ample asymmetric influence. The exercise examines power relations among the 130-odd members of the global south found in the ;G;77, a ;UN; grouping.

;;
;;
;

;America has been the country with the most influence over the ;G; 77 since the 1970s (see chart 1).即使前殖民大国的诱惑，英国和法国的诱惑也逐渐减弱，它的“影响力能力”或多或少是恒定的。 But it is increasingly rivalled by China, which after 40 years of relative insignificance saw its influence grow from around 2000. According to the index, China's “influence capacity” over the ;G;77 is roughly double that of France, the third-most influential country, and around three times that of Britain, India or the ;UAE;.

;

;China wields the most influence in 31 countries.它的影响力在巴基斯坦，孟加拉国，俄罗斯和东南亚的几个州。 By contrast the next-most powerful member of the global south, India, is top dog with only six ;G;77 members. According to an earlier analysis by ;PCIF;, from 1992 to 2020 the number of countries over which China had more influence than America almost doubled, from 33 to 61. The United States remains pre-eminent in the Americas. But China has extended its influence in Africa and Asia.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;;The emporium of everything;

;

;Recently, China has become a lot keener on the idea of the global south.去年，XI先生和中国高级官员开始将中国称为“全球南方”的一部分，他们迄今已抗拒了这一描述（该术语在1960年代归功于美国的左翼学者），赞成像“这样的短语”。发展中国家家族”。语义转变反映了以反西方和中文为主导的术语来定义短语的尝试。 9月，中国发表了关于不断变化的国际机构，规则和法律的建议。它声称这是“真正的多边主义”的愿景，其中“通用安全”取代了“普遍价值观”，换句话说，一个不是由干扰西方经营的。 Last year China's then foreign minister argued that the main divide in the world was not democracy versus autocracy, as Mr Biden has implied, but “between development and containment of development, and between global justice and power politics”.

;

;China is intensely strategic about winning influence, by targeting swing states with infrastructure support, financing and more. From 2000 to 2021 it funded more than 20,000 infrastructure projects, many of which were under the “Belt and Road Initiative” (;BRI;), across 165 countries with aid or credit worth $1.3trn.一些分析师指出，数据表明，来自中国出口国外银行等大型国家支持贷方的信贷正在枯竭。 But a paper published in November by AidData, a group from William & Mary university, argues otherwise.其中一位作者布拉德利·帕克斯（Bradley Parks）说：“与传统的智慧相反，北京没有撤退。”该论文发现，当今发展中国家有更多的实体扩展到发展中国家：2021年，它每年的贷款为80亿美元。 “[China] remains the single largest source of international development finance in the world.”

;

;China is targeting geopolitical fence-sitters.艾德达（Aiddata）认为，大约三分之二的中国融资都流向了“折腾”国家，中国和美国都没有明显地持有。 The group has identified a quid pro quo: if a foreign government increases its share of votes at the ;UN; General Assembly (;UNGA;) that align with China's by 10 percentage points, it can expect a 276% increase, on average, in financing from Beijing. China has also used its weight to curry favour on subjects such as its repression in Xinjiang. From 2000 to 2021 “low- and middle-income countries” voted on foreign-policy decisions with China 75% of the time at the ;UNGA;. The impact of China's raw power was on show last year at the ;BRICS; summit, too, where it successfully pushed for five new members of the bloc.

;

;China uses other tools, too.它是120多个国家的主要贸易伙伴。 It has provided $240bn, mostly since 2016, in emergency financing of the sort the ;IMF ;specialises in. China also builds infrastructure projects quickly in developing countries, pleasing their elites, and subsidises the roll-out of digital technologies such as those of Huawei. Over the past five years it has overtaken Russia as the main source of weapons for sub-Saharan Africa.

;

;;Buyer's remorse;

;

;Though China's leadership position among the ;G;77 is formidable, it faces problems.首先，其影响力范围和强度有限。它尚未在拉丁美洲获得领先地位。在整个全球南部，它尚未果断地赢得心灵。民意调查显示，发展中国家对美国和中国的支持分裂。监视非洲的公众舆论的非洲裔计算机指出，对美国有积极看法的人的份额有所下降。然而，这个数字在2022年仍然是49％（尽管2019年的60％下降了）。上个月，东南亚的一项调查要求受访者在新的冷战时宁愿他们的国家保持一致：50.5％的受访者选择了中国； 49.5％选择美国。 When asked what countries should do about Sino-American rivalry, most opted against picking a side.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;China's conduct and political values may stunt its influence.它在商业和政治方面的行动吸引了责任。 Countries sometimes lay the blame for their debt crises at China's door.在刚果和其他资源丰富的国家，中国矿工面临着与西方人相同的剥削指控（而且往往更严重）。 China's disdain for values-based interactions (it preaches non-interference instead) is apparent, and most of the one-party state's closest pals are also autocratic.民主价值观强大的全球南部国家，例如巴西，不太可能与中国建立密切的文化联系。更重要的是，随着中国更接近伊朗和俄罗斯之类的人，它可能会与想要摧毁而不是改革国际秩序的国家盟国。 Witness its recent nihilistic decision to cut a deal with the Iranian-backed Houthi rebels over shipping in the Red Sea and Suez Canal, instead of working on a common solution.

;

;Meanwhile China's economic reputation could deteriorate.它通过贷款狂欢所赢得的公众支持发生在需要偿还的钱之前。 Some 75% of its ;BRI; loans will require the principal to be paid back by 2030. It is probably no coincidence that the share of Africans who see China as having a positive impact on its development dipped from 59% to 49% from 2019 to 2022, according to Afrobarometer. Mr Xi's latest response to economic problems in China is to launch massive industrial subsidies which could lead to manufactured goods flooding the markets of other emerging economies. Though some consumers may benefit, another “China shock” may stunt the industrial ambitions of governments in the global south.

;

;Even as China faces headwinds, new rivals are emerging whose influence in the global south is rising.印度是领先者。 By 2045, as its economic, diplomatic and military links increase, its influence over the global south will overtake that of Britain and France, and place it behind America and China, according to forecasts by ;PCIF;. The number of Indian embassies in Africa increased from 25 to 43 between 2012 and 2022. It is the continent's fourth-largest trade partner and fifth-largest source of foreign-direct investment, according to Mr Modi. India's own Export-Import bank has lent $12bn across 42 African nations over the past decade, according to Bloomberg. Last year it held training exercises with armed forces from 25 African countries.

;

;India also has a very different proposition on values. It sees itself as ;vishwaguru;, or “teacher to the world”, in areas where it has specialisms.例如，它向埃塞俄比亚，塞拉利昂和斯里兰卡等国家提供了其数字平台的“堆栈”（包括生物识别技术）。印度政府正在向私立医院借钱在非洲成立。 And in November the Indian Institute of Technology opened its first campus abroad, on the island of Zanzibar, in Tanzania.

;

;Some of India's power is unquantifiable. As a flawed democracy with an ultra-pragmatic foreign policy (it has forged closer bonds with America at the same time as refusing to condemn Russia's invasion of Ukraine) it is closer to the median worldview among the ;G;77 than is China. India's pitch to lead is also substantively different.因为它比美国领导的世界更担心中国领导的亚洲，所以它对改革国际规则的方法本质上更务实。 It wants to be a bridge to the West, not a battering ram.

;

;Other countries have specialist claims to power.如果中国是一家影响力的超市，那么它在全球南方的竞争对手就像精品店一样，为其他成员提供了较小的定制商品。海湾国家正在使用其一部分碳氢化合物意外收获，用于发展中国家的可再生能源项目和采矿资产。土耳其公司通常是中国基础设施项目的主要竞争对手。 they have laid rail tracks across East Africa, built the national stadium in Rwanda and airports in Senegal and Niger.

;

;Brazil, the world's second-largest agricultural exporter, is using its chairmanship of the ;G;20 this year to promote food security in the global south. 2月，卢拉（Lula）将该信息带到了非洲联盟大陆集团的年度会议上。多么荒谬，在西部的部分地区，南非的某些部分似乎是事实上的道德南方领导人，将以色列带到了国际法院，因为他涉嫌在加沙涉嫌种族灭绝，并领导着非洲国家的“和平任务” to Ukraine and Russia.

;

;Lastly, America and its allies are not out of the game. Rich countries in the ;OECD; group spend more than $200bn annually in overseas aid (loans make up most of China's financing). Over the past 20 years American firms have spent $515bn in foreign-direct investment in the countries in the bigger ;BRICS; bloc (excluding China), versus just $215bn from Chinese ones. Trade between sub-Saharan Africa and, in total, America and the euro area, is greater than that between the region and China, according to IMF data.

;

;In addition to alliances such as ;NATO;, America has defence partnerships with 76 countries.西方国家仍然是寻求更好生活和寻求教育子女的精英的经济移民的首选选择。西方还试图解决其弱点。 In 2021 the ;G;7 outspent China in infrastructure commitments, reckons AidData. America's Development Finance Corporation has as much as $60bn to spend on extending credit or buying equity in firms in developing countries. America and France want the World Bank to offer more cheap loans and investment in green technologies.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;;
;Ringside seat;

;

;China probably hopes to see off this competition.然而，即使这样做，它也将是一个团队中的领导力量，它永远不会因其成员之间的凝聚而定义。 In November Brazil's Lula argued of the global south that “there are many more interests that unite us than differences that separate us.”实际上，到处都有分歧。 More than 40 countries have consistently abstained or supported Russia in ;UNGA; votes about Ukraine.大约8％的国家占过去30年全球排放量的78％。那些中等收入国家的利益与印度和南非等碳密集型能源相比，与少数使用能源的贫困国家非常不同。一个团体想要钱来进行“公正过渡”； the other just wants more electricity to power its development.

;

;Reducing Western influence at international institutions is a goal China and many others embrace.但是细节很快变得棘手。 China is not going to welcome India permanently on to the ;UN; Security Council; Brazil and South Africa regularly disagree at the ;WTO; over agriculture; debtor countries and creditors like China want different things from World Bank or ;IMF ;reform.中国会发现，全球南方国家将追求其国家利益，并经常与西方，中国以及彼此之间发生冲突。换句话说，全球南方不想要领导者。这是一个比赛区。 Just not one that can be located on a map.  ;■;

;;I;;N THE; run-up to Ukraine's rocket attacks on the Antonovsky Bridge, a vital road crossing from the occupied city of Kherson to the eastern bank of the Dnipro River, security officials carefully studied a series of special reports.那是 2022 年夏天，俄罗斯严重依赖这座桥为其第聂伯河以西的部队提供补给。这些报告包含对两件事的研究：摧毁这座桥是否会导致俄罗斯士兵或其家人感到恐慌？ And, more importantly, how could Ukraine's government maximise the blow to morale by creating “a particular information environment”?

;

;This is how Sviatoslav Hnizdovsky, the founder of the Open Minds Institute (;OMI;) in Kyiv, describes the work his research outfit did by generating these assessments with artificial intelligence (;AI;).算法对俄罗斯社交媒体内容和社会经济数据进行了筛选，涉及从酒精消费和人口流动到在线搜索和消费者行为等各种内容。 The ;AI; correlated any changes with the evolving sentiments of Russian “loyalists” and liberals over the potential plight of their country's soldiers.

;

;This highly sensitive work continues to shape important Ukrainian decisions about the course of the war, says Mr Hnizdovsky. This includes potential future strikes on Russia's ;Kerch Bridge;, which is the only direct land link between Russia and Crimea.

;;

;Armed with ChatGPT

;

;Ukraine, outgunned by Russia, is increasingly seeking an edge with ;AI; by ;employing the technology in diverse ways;. A Ukrainian colonel involved in arms development says drone designers commonly query Chat;GPT; as a “start point” for engineering ideas, like novel techniques for reducing vulnerability to Russian jamming. Another military use for ;AI;, says the colonel, who requested anonymity, is to identify targets.

;

;As soldiers and military bloggers have wisely become more careful with their posts, simple searches for any clues about the location of forces have become less fruitful. By ingesting reams of images and text, however, ;AI ;models can find potential clues, stitch them together and then surmise the likely location of a weapons system or a troop formation. Using this “puzzle-pieces” approach with ;AI; allows Molfar, an intelligence firm with offices in Dnipro and Kyiv, to typically find two to five valuable targets every day, says Maksym Zrazhevsky, an analyst with the firm 。 Once discovered, this intelligence is quickly passed along to Ukraine's army, resulting in some of the targets being destroyed.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;Targeting is being assisted by ;AI; in other ways. Smanticforce是一家立陶宛公司，在乌克兰西部的Kyiv和Ternopil设有办事处，开发了模型，以响应文本提示在线或上传文本和图像。 Many of SemanticForce's clients use the system commercially to monitor public sentiments about their brands.然而，莫尔法使用该模型来绘制俄罗斯军队可能士气低落和补给不足的地区，这可能使他们成为较软的目标。 The ;AI; finds clues in pictures, including those from drone footage, and from soldiers bellyaching in social media.

;;U;;NTIL RECENTLY; Captain James Cook was not a particularly controversial figure. But in January a statue of the 18th-century British sailor and explorer was toppled in Melbourne and the words “The colony will fall” spraypainted on the plinth. In Hawaii an obelisk in Cook's memory has been splattered with red paint and the message “You are on native land.” Cook has joined Edward Colston, Robert Clive and Cecil Rhodes as a focal point for anti-colonialist ire.

;

;In fact Cook was neither a slave trader nor much of an imperialist. He was, first and foremost, a brilliant navigator and cartographer. Acting under Admiralty orders, he undertook three pioneering voyages in the Pacific between 1768 and 1779. His mapmaking transformed Europeans' knowledge of the world's largest ocean.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;An excellent new book draws on Cook's letters and notebooks to tell the story of his third and final trip. Cook was almost 50 when he set off on ;;HMS ;Resolution ;in July 1776. Among the crew he took were William Bligh (later captain of the ;Bounty ;before the mutiny in 1789) and Mai, a Tahitian prince noted for being painted by Sir Joshua Reynolds. Cook had secret instructions from the Admiralty not only to claim new territory for Britain, but to search for a north-west passage via the Bering Strait (a task even someone with his navigational experience found impossible).

;

;The author, Hampton Sides, focuses on Cook's return to Australia and New Zealand—countries the explorer had first encountered almost a decade earlier—his discovery of the Society Islands (today part of French Polynesia) and his time in Hawaii. It was there, in February 1779, that he was killed after a botched attempt to kidnap a local chief in response to the theft of a longboat.

;

;Cook was a man of his times. He believed Europe would have a civilising influence on many benighted folk in the Pacific. He was distinctly cruel in meting out punishments, to his own crew as well as to any indigenous people who opposed him.

;

;Yet Cook also admired many of the people and places he encountered in the South Pacific. Unlike the Spanish, he had no interest in religious conversion. He tried hard to stop his men from spreading venereal disease. For the most part, his land claims were aimed not at promoting a British empire but forestalling grabs by Britain's rivals, France and Spain.

;

;As the author makes clear, there is a balance to be struck between justified admiration for Cook's seamanship and a legitimate resentment of the colonialism that followed indigenous peoples' first contact with Europeans. Today many Western countries are divided over how to think about such vexed legacies. In 2020 half of Britons thought it was right that Colston's statue was removed (though many disapproved of it being dumped in Bristol harbour). Cook's statue still stands in central London, as does Clive's—and Rhodes's in Oxford. The question is whether they will enjoy their perches much longer. ;■;

;;M;;ORE THAN; two decades have passed since we published an academic paper linking the legalisation of abortion to the enormous decline in American crime since the 1990s. The underlying theory is straightforward.出生时不需要的儿童面临着一系列不良生活结果的风险，并在以后的生活中犯下了更多犯罪。合法的堕胎大大减少了不需要的出生人数。 Consequently, legalised abortion will reduce crime, albeit with substantial lags.

;

;Our paper created much controversy, which was further stoked by a chapter on the topic in the best-selling book “Freakonomics”, written by one of us with Stephen Dubner, published in 2005. For many, it was more important to spin a political response to our hypothesis than to evaluate whether it was correct.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;The data available at the time strongly supported our hypothesis. We showed, for instance, that crime began falling sooner in the five states that legalised abortion in advance of ;Roe v Wade;, the US Supreme Court decision that made abortion available legally nationwide.我们记录说，堕胎率高和低的州的犯罪遵循了多年的趋势几乎相同的趋势，然后仅在出生同龄人参加合法流产达到他们犯罪的年龄之后，才突然而持续分歧。 Consistent with our theory, looking at arrest data, which reveal the age of the offender, the declines in crime were concentrated among those born after abortion became legal.

;

;These data patterns do not, of course, make an open-and-shut case. No randomised experiment has been conducted on this topic. We also didn't help our own case by mislabelling the set of control variables included in one of the specifications in one of our tables—a regrettable mistake (later corrected) which led some people to dismiss all of the paper's findings. One of the most vocal and consistently sceptical voices arguing against our findings has been ;The Economist;, which has written about our study on three occasions (most recently ;last month;), each time taking a critical and dismissive stance.

;

;We concede that reasonable people could disagree about how convincing the findings were in our initial paper. The analysis was retrospective, and there is always the concern that researchers have cherry-picked their findings, or that perhaps it was just pure coincidence that the patterns emerged.

;

;There is, however, something unique about our hypothesis, which allows a second test of the theory that is far closer to the ideal of the scientific method.进行堕胎与受影响的队列达到犯罪的年龄之间存在很长的滞后。因此，在2001年的第一篇学术论文时，我们已经可以对我们的理论预测将发生在未来的犯罪中做出有力的预测。 Indeed, at the end of that paper, we made the following prediction: “When a steady state is reached roughly 20 years from now, the impact of abortion will be roughly twice as great as the impact felt so far. Our results suggest that all else equal, legalised abortion will account for persistent declines of 1% a year in crime over the next two decades.”

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;It is rare—almost unprecedented—in academic economics to be able to make a testable prediction and then to go back and actually test it decades later. That's what we did in a ;paper; published in 2020. Our methodological approach was straightforward: mimic the specifications reported in our original paper, but limit the time period to the years that were out of sample, ie, those after our original data ended.

;

;The results provided stunning corroboration of our predictions. For each of the seven different analyses we had presented in the initial 2001 paper, the results for next two decades of data were at least as strong as the results in our initial dataset, and in most specifications even stronger. This included what the main critics of our 2001 paper called the “crucial” test, showing that the abortion rate at the time of any birth cohort negatively correlated with the age-specific arrest rate for that cohort years later as it moved through ages 15–24, while perfectly controlling for whatever other factors were influencing crime in a given state and a given year. We would argue that, short of a randomised experiment, this is some of the most compelling evidence one could present.

;

;The magnitude of the implied impacts we are talking about is huge. If you look over the entire sample, violent-crime rates fell by 62.2 percentage points in high-abortion states whereas they rose by 3.1% in low-abortion states.

;

;Though there is not complete acceptance of our hypothesis among academics, all agree that if our paper is not correct, then there is no viable explanation for the enormous drop in crime in America that started in the early 1990s. Indeed, there is not even an arguable theory to supplant the abortion-crime link. Exposure to lead in the environment might, perhaps, be the next best hypothesis. But as we showed in our 2020 paper, when one controls for both environmental lead and abortion, the coefficient on abortion remains large while the coefficient on environmental lead is greatly reduced and loses statistical significance.

;

;It seems fair to ask why, in spite of strong supporting evidence, no academic contradiction of any of the findings of our 2020 paper and support for the abortion-crime link from ;international evidence;, so many observers remain sceptical of the hypothesis.毫不奇怪，那些生计来自在大幅犯罪期间与犯罪作斗争的人并不渴望得出结论，他们的方法（无论是更多的警察，更多的监禁或特定的社会计划） - 无论他们可能是重要的重要因素，而不是衰落的主要因素。 Another possible explanation is that people across the political spectrum were uncomfortable with our conclusions. Many people would prefer that our hypothesis not be true—perhaps not recognising that the core finding is that when women can control their fertility the life outcomes of their children are greatly enhanced.

;

;History is full of instances where new scientific theories were resisted by those who found them inconvenient. By and large, history hasn't been kind to the resisters.;■;
